page.title: 08CHURCHES OF SHIELDAIG
page.content: THE CHURCH HAS ALWAYS PLAYED AN IMPORTANT PART IN HIGHLAND LIFE. THIS CAN BE SEEN BY THE NUMBER OF CHURCHES IN SMALL VILLAGES SUCH AS SHIELDAIG. SHIELAIG HAS AN IMPORTANT PLACE IN CHURCH HISTORY. IN 1877 A PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH WAS BUILT IN THE VILLAGE. THE FIRST MINISTER REV. D. MACDONALD OPPOSED THE ACT OF UNIFORMITY OF THE CHURCH IN 1895. HE WAS ASKED TO LEAVE THE CHURCH AND MANSE. FROM THEN ON HE HELD HIS SERVICES BEHIND A LARGE WALL, STILL TO BE SEEN BESIDE THE SCHOOL. A FREE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH WAS BUILT IN 1897. THE OLD CHURCH WAS NEVER AGAIN USED FOR SERVICES AND HAD A LIFE OF ONLY TWENTY YEARS. IT IS NOW A GARAGE. THE VILLAGE ALSO HAS A CHURCH OF SCOTLAND, BUT NEITHER CHURCH HAS A RESIDENT MINISTER.
